alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 12:45AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, northwestern Rutherford and eastern Williamson Counties through 115 AM CST... At 1244 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Thompson`s Station, or 7 miles southwest of Franklin, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Spring Hill, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Thompson`s Station, Antioch, Rural Hill, Berry Hill, Triune, Leipers Fork and Percy Priest Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 213 and 218. Interstate 65 between mile markers 53 and 79. Interstate 24 between mile markers 52 and 72. Interstate 840 between mile markers 21 and 45, and near mile marker 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
